title: The Southern Explorer: Heights & Parks
subtitle: Hidden gems, panoramic views, and local history
description: A 3-hour journey through the less-visited but incredibly scenic southern half of the city. Navigate deep urban canyons, catch 360-degree views from high peaks, loop through McLaren Park, and pass by historic landmarks like the Cow Palace.

stops.name: Twin Peaks
stops.description: Start high up for a spectacular, unobstructed 360-degree view of the entire San Francisco Bay Area.

stops.name: Glen Canyon Park
stops.description: A surprising and beautiful deep canyon drive right in the middle of the city's residential neighborhoods.

stops.name: John Shelley Drive (McLaren Park)
stops.description: A fantastic, winding 2-mile scenic loop right through the middle of McLaren Park, offering unique views of the city's southeast edge.

stops.name: Cow Palace
stops.description: Drive by this historic arena situated directly on the border of San Francisco and Daly City, which has hosted everything from livestock shows to The Beatles.

stops.name: Candlestick Point State Recreation Area
stops.description: Enjoy the sweeping views of the South Bay, the San Bruno Mountain, and the historic Hunters Point shipyards from the water's edge.
